properties.areaDesc: Northeast Mountains; Northern Panhandle; Central Panhandle Mountains
properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 4 at 4:44AM PST until January 4 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Southwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts as high as 40 mph
expected in the lowlands. Gusts of 55 mph or more expected in
the mountains on exposed ridge tops.

* WHERE...In Washington, Northeast Mountains. In Idaho, Northern
Panhandle and Central Panhandle Mountains.

* WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Saturday. The strongest wind gusts will
likely occur this morning and early this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power
outages may result. Higher elevations could see blowing and
drifting snow.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Recreation in the mountains will be
potentially dangerous due to the combination of gusty winds,
blowing snow, and bitterly cold wind chills.
properties.instruction:
Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose
or lightweight outdoor objects. High winds can break tree limbs
and cause power outages.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON
